collection.collection_title: Leo Reisman collection of sound recordings, 1932-1948
collection.collection_description: The Leo Reisman collection contains primarily private acetate disc recordings of Reisman's radio performances of the 1930's, as well as Reisman's personal collection of commercial 78 rpm discs. Included among the noncommercial recordings are extensive holdings of his Philip Morris Show and Schaefer's nine o'clock revue appearances. Less complete holdings for Lucky Strike's your hit parade are also included. The commercial disc collection is comprised mostly of Reisman's commercially released recordings, as well as a small number of other artists' recordings
collection_holder_name: New York Public Library for the Performing Arts, Dorothy and Lewis B. Cullman Center
collection.historical_relevance: Leo Reisman was a bandleader from 1916 into the 1950's, most prominently in the 1930's. During the 1930's Reisman led bands that played on radio shows such as Lucky Strike's Your Hit Parade (1937-1939), Philip Morris radio programs (1934-1937), and Schaefer Beer's Nine O'clock Revue (1937).  Reisman continued to lead bands through the 1940's and into the 1950's, playing in hotel ballrooms in New York and Cincinnati. Reisman died in 1961.
